column4: I got my custom built 8.10 live CD to start in Vbox but it hangs at "Starting periodic command scheduler crond   [OK]"
I got my custom built 8.10 live CD to start in Vbox but it hangs at "Starting periodic command scheduler crond   [OK]" any idea what I need to do?
so something is wrong with you "custom built" cd - can you try the origional cd instead?
it's actually whatever comes after the output you're giving as Cron ends with OK...
you stated "Starting periodic command scheduler crond   [OK]" which tells us the crond started fine...
oh. I wonder what it trys to do after that
typically Persistent installs use USB drivers -- you understand that a persistent CD would need some sort of HD storage.
I am the casper-rw on a USB drive
I have the casper-rw on a USB drive. Should I install things like display drivers when in persistent?
i don't know man - i've only ever used the USB creator to create persistent USB keys - no idea how to do it manually
to find your graphics card you can use "lspci | grep -i vga"
how can I use that once I have it? Also will that work on a laptop?
can I set the result as a var then see if it equals something then chosse the right x config
that will just output what graphics card you have - it won't show you the correct driver or anything - but will allow you to google/post here with your card.
I'm sorry at an internet cafe and running out of time bye
